metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2972 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
expand.c in Exim before 4.83 expands mathematical comparisons twice, which allows local users to gain privileges and execute arbitrary commands via a crafted lookup value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2972` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> patch may introduce behaviour change

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.1').
